channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres is 'telling show executives she's had enough'
item.description: DailyMail.com can reveal that the host is telling executives at Telepictures and Warner Bros that she has had enough and wants to walk away from the show.

item.title: Woman who underwent first face transplant in the U.S.has died age 57
item.description: Dr. Frank Papay, chair of the Cleveland Clinic's Dermatology and Plastic Surgery Institute, did not list Connie Culp's cause of death in his statement.

item.title: James Murdoch steps down from the board of News Corp over 'disagreements over editorial content'
item.description: James Murdoch announced he is stepping down from the board of News Corp, citing editorial differences over content published by its media platforms, which include The Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Donald Trump announces he will BAN TikTok in the U.S.
item.description: Speaking aboard Air Force One on Friday the president told reporters: 'As far as TikTok is concerned, we're banning them from the United States.'

item.title: TV BAFTA 2020 winners: Idris Elba thanks the Academy for 'finally recognising' him
item.description: The actor, 47, thanked the Academy for 'finally recognising' him as he was virtually reunited with his Luther co-star Ruth Wilson and presented with the Special Award.

item.title: Inside the FIRST EVER virtual TV BAFTAs with Richard Ayoade
item.description: Friday saw the first ever virtual British Academy of Film and Television Awards broadcast on the BBC as the ceremony adapted to COVID-19 precautions.

item.title: Dame Barbara Windsor, 82, is moved to a care home amid her battle with dementia
item.description: The 82-year-old EastEnders star's husband Scott Mitchell revealed the news to The Sun on Friday, as he admitted he was 'heartbroken' by the move.

item.title: TV BAFTAs 2020: Viewers in tears at tribute to Caroline Flack
item.description: Viewers watching the 2020 TV BAFTAs on Friday evening were moved to tears as the Academy paid tribute to the media stars who passed away in 2019 and 2020 - including Love Island's Caroline Flack.

item.title: TV BAFTAs 2020: Richard Ayoade hosts virtual ceremony
item.description: The 2020 British Academy Television Awards finally took place on Friday, though many nominees were forced to appear on webcam as the event was socially-distanced for the first time in its history.

item.title: Kodak boss took out stock options day before failed photo company was awarded taxpayer-funded loan
item.description: Kodak CEO, Jim Continenza (above) was awarded stock options that could net him profit of over $30million a day before Trump administration announced $765million loan to the firm.

item.title: The tense 36 hours that led Boris to put the brakes on
item.description: Grave forecasts of a second coronavirus onslaught sparked a series of behind-the-scenes discussions which resulted in the rowing back of curb lifting.

item.title: What trade-offs are likely to be needed to keep the virus under control?
item.description: At a gloomy Downing Street press conference yesterday, Boris Johnson was unable to deliver the usual good news of a relaxation of lockdown rules, moving the country a step back to normality.

item.title: Calm before the storm! Britain struggles through barmy night after 100F heat but rain is on the way
item.description: It was calm before the storm this morning as rain was feared just 24 hours after sunseekers surged to beaches across Britain on what is the third hottest day ever recorded with temperatures hitting 100F

item.title: Former British army officer is facing 13 years in jail
item.description: Thomas Lishman, 58, was detained by Romanian authorities on December 15 after the event at a retreat outside the capital Bucharest where he served people with ayahuasca, file photo.

item.title: Popular influencer goes viral with insane job posting for a personal assistant
item.description: The LA-based YouTuber shared the job posting for this week, promising $25 to $30 an hour for a 'part-time' job wherein the assistant needs to be on-site 8 hours a day and on-call 24/7.

item.title: Boy is declared 'a hero' after antics in the background of BBC beach report
item.description: A young boy has become the unlikely star of a weather report after he decided to crash BBC news reporter Jen Bartram's live TV broadcast on a beach in South Shields.

item.title: More than half of furloughed employees have ALREADY returned to work
item.description: More than half of furloughed employees have already returned to work ahead of the scheme being phased out from Saturday, new research suggests.

item.title: Matt Hancock ties himself in knots about whether people in Manchester can leave the area
item.description: The Health Secretary was speaking to BBC Radio Manchester and appeared so flustered by the question host Becky Want told him: 'You sound confused'.

item.title: Government's scientific advisers warn tension over local lockdowns could need military presence
item.description: The current 'volatile and highly complex situation' means the UK will face 'grave challenges' in maintaining public order, according to a paper considered by SAGE in July.

item.title: New MI6 boss Richard Moore's grandad was IRA fighter who won medal for fighting against British rule
item.description: The grandfather of the new MI6 boss Richard Moore was an IRA fighter, from 1916 until 1922, who won a medal from the Sinn Fein Irish president for fighting against British rule.

item.title: SIMON WALTERS: Boris Johnson stuffs House of Lords with his cronies
item.description: SIMON WALTERS: In his journalistic career Mr Johnson once managed to introduce the topic of 'Kylie Minogue's bottom' into an article about House of Lords reform.

item.title: Royal aides despair that Covid-secure quarters in Balmoral are like 'Colditz prison camp'
item.description: 'Stir-crazy' aides are preparing Balmoral for the Queen and Prince Philip's arrival. Servants have been banned from socialising as a safety measure to protect the royals from coronavirus.

item.title: Prefabulous! How one family replaced their bungalow with a flat-packed house now worth £1.5million
item.description: The Mail has followed the fortunes of the Buckland family -Gary, 48, Emma, 46, and their sons as they attempted to turn their long-held dream of building a high-end prefab house into a reality.

item.title: Coldstream Guards investigated by police after bar brawl with Queen's footmen near Buckingham Palace
item.description: The incident happened last Friday when a group of footmen went to a leaving drinks gathering at the Greenwood Sports Pub, just minutes away from their accommodation in the Royal Mews.

item.title: Professor Chris Whitty suggests Britons will have to sacrifice meeting friends and family
item.description: At a Downing Street press conference, chief medical officer Chris Whitty warned the country had 'probably reached near the limit or the limits' of what can be done to return to life as normal for now.

item.title: Facebook set to add official music videos from artists to take on YouTube
item.description: Facebook is taking on YouTube by adding official music videos to its platform in the US. The clips will be added to Facebook Watch, as well as the artists' pages. The rollout is set for August 1.

item.title: Why ARE wild boar on the rampage next to a millionaire Ben Goldsmith's farm?
item.description: Rewilding enthusiast Ben Goldsmith denies releasing wild boar near the village of Witham Friary in Somerset. The financier admits to feeding the wild animals, which is not a criminal offence.

item.title: Archaeologist says 3,000-year-old clay heads are of God's face
item.description: An archaeologist claims three clay heads depict the earliest images of God. The figures date back 3,000 years and were uncovered in Israel along with horse statues, which align with biblical scripture.

item.title: The £800k golden wonder to £30k champagne basket, how the billionaire in life can saddle up in style
item.description: Clingy lycra, helmet hair and a rusty bicycle you have not ridden in years - cycling does not exactly have a glamorous reputation. But if you are a billionaire who bikes, there are lots of options.

item.title: British 28-stone conman, 74, is spared jail because he is too fat
item.description: Jail staff would have problems looking after 28-stone Barry Beardall, 74, including when getting him out of bed and giving him medication, Judge Peter Henry told Southampton Crown Court yesterday.

item.title: Less than HALF of Britons are social distancing at all times, ONS survey reveals
item.description: Only 47 per cent of people say they 'always' keep a safe distance from others, according to the latest statistics from the ONS. The Office for National Statistics surveyed 1,500 people from July 22 to 26.

item.title: Pictured: Lawrence Fox is seen with new girlfriend for the first time
item.description: Laurence Fox's infamous appearance on Question Time, when he sparked a row by accusing a mixed-race audience member of making a racist comment, is said to have jeapordised his acting career.

item.title: Athlete shows how deceptive Instagram poses can be in photos
item.description: Victoria Garrick, 23, from California, struggled with body image issues after joining the University of Southern California women's indoor volleyball in 2015, but has learned to love her body.

item.title: Celebrities including Amanda Holden and Coleen Rooney post holiday pictures from paradise
item.description: Brits headed to Spain for their holidays now face a 14 day quarantine on their return to the UK, but that has not stopped celebrities jetting off to exotic locations around Europe this summer.

item.title: Polish towns that declared themselves 'LGBT free' are denied funding by Brussels
item.description: Six towns that declared themselves 'LGBT Free' or banned campaigning for the rights of same-sex couples, have had their requests for town twinning, which comes with lucrative funding, rejected by EU.

item.title: John Bercow and Tom Watson absent from new peers list
item.description: Boris Johnson has approved former MPs who rebelled against Labour to back Brexit, including Kate Hoey and Ian Austin, in the list of 36 new peers to join the House of Lords.

item.title: Social distancing observed as the hajj pilgrimage gets underway in Mecca amid coronavirus crisis
item.description: Strict social distancing measures were in place as a limited number of Muslim pilgrims of Saudi Arabia residents gathered at the Great Mosque in Mecca during the third day of the hajj pilgrimage.

item.title: Wigan residents say they're unfairly included in lockdown area
item.description: Wigan residents expressed anger at the Government's new lockdown restrictions, questioning why they should apply to them when they have one of the lowest infection rates in the region.

item.title: Tom Moore describes honour at being awarded the freedom of his home town of Keighley
item.description: Captain Sir Tom Moore was awarded with the freedom of his home town of Keighley during a special ceremony at the Town Hall Square in Keighley, West Yorkshire, today.

item.title: Longstanding royal courtier Sir Alan 'Tommy' Lascelles' hatred of King Edward VIII
item.description: SIR ALAN LASCELLES: For some years after I joined his staff in 1920, I had a great affection and admiration for the Prince of Wales.

item.title: DR MAX THE MIND DOCTOR: It's not a tall story - height can be bad for your health
item.description: DR MAX: As a society we value height. Research shows that taller people tend to have higher self-esteem while a study of Swedish men found shorter people were at higher risk of suicide...

item.title: With the future of our economy in peril, JOHN HUMPHRYS says: Let's get to work on boom town Britain
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: There are probably more jokes about economists than there are economists themselves. The oldest is that if you bring ten economists together you will get eleven opinions.

item.title: How dreary! HENRY DEEDES watches party pooper PM and his Captain Cautious halt lockdown easing
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: The Prime Minister raised a chubby paw aloft like an overzealous lollipop lady and announced in that peculiarly elastic voice he was calling things to a halt.

item.title: Dinner's on Dishy Rishi! Everything you need to know to get up to £10 off your meal per head
item.description: The scheme was unveiled by the Chancellor as part of his Covid-19 mini budget in July - designed to rescue the economy from a coronavirus-induced recession.

item.title: RICHARD EDEN: Drama to be made about Sarah Ferguson's former dresser...
item.description: RICHARD EDEN: I can disclose that a big-budget television drama is to be made about Fergie's former dresser, Jane Andrews, who murdered her banker boyfriend...

item.title: NAZIR AFZAL: No more hiding the truth about Covid
item.description: NAZIR AFZAL: Were it not for coronavirus, the holy city of Mecca in Saudi Arabia would be teeming with humanity. Every year, around two million Muslims gather there to mark the Hajj.

item.title: Kim Kardashian is pictured in Los Angeles as embattled husband Kanye West tweets he's quite alright
item.description: Dressed in all black, it was a low-key outing for the 39-year-old E! star, who donned a black mask as she left Cedars-Sinai hospital in the Beverly Hills area.

item.title: Prince William reassures Gareth Southgate speaking about mental health is 'not a weakness'
item.description: In a video released today by the Heads Up campaign, Gareth, 49, speaks candidly to the Duke of Cambridge, 38, about his mental health.

item.title: Virginia Giuffre describes Ghislaine Maxwell's private parts in unsealed court docs
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre described Ghislaine Maxwel''s private parts in newly unsealed court documents. Giuffre filed the defamation lawsuit against Maxwell in 2016.

item.title: Beer gardens are rammed as thousands ignore social distancing rules on hottest day of the year
item.description: Large groups of people were seen drinking in pub gardens in London appearing to ignore social distancing rules the same day it is announced the north of England will roll back easing of lockdown.

item.title: Prince Charles dons traditional Scottish wear to give 'morale boost' on hospital visit
item.description: Prince Charles wore a kilt when visiting Caithness General Hospital in Wick, Scotland. The Prince of Wales thanked the health workers for their 'dedication and hard work' amid the Covid pandemic.

item.title: British ISIS Beatles 'will be spared the death penalty by America so they can face trial'
item.description: El Shafee Elsheikh and Alexanda Kotey, who are currently in US custody in Iraq, are accused of belonging to a four-man execution cell in Syria named after the band by their captives.

item.title: High speed train derailed after hitting vehicle in Portugal
item.description: The train, an Alfa Pendular which connects all the major cities in Portugal, is understood to have derailed after a collision as it was heading south from Coimbra.

item.title: Why Woody Harrelson's father was a REAL Natural Born Killer
item.description: Woody was just seven years old when, in 1968, his father Charles left his wife Diane and their three sons at their Houston, Texas home.

item.title: Thousands of hard-up pensioners 'face food and fuel poverty' as their free TV licences are scrapped
item.description: The BBC's decision to scrap the freebie for most over-75s means more than three million UK households will be asked to stump up the £157.50 annual fee for the first time.

item.title: Sport is reeling as Boris Johnson puts the brakes on the return of fans
item.description: Around 5,000 racegoers were expected at the Glorious Goodwood festival, and cricket fans were to be allowed back in for two fixtures in the Bob Willis Trophy at the Oval and Edgbaston.

item.title: 'This is not justice - even the judge said they could kill again': Friend of PC Andrew Harper says
item.description: Lissie Harper, 28, breaking down twice at the Old Bailey, said: 'My husband was brutally killed four weeks after our wedding day.'

item.title: Police officer injured in mass street brawl after Eid party in Ilford
item.description: The Metropolitan Police received numerous calls from the public about the large group of people gathered on the street ahead of the religious festival in Ilford on Thursday night.

item.title: UK teenager, 19, from Bognor Regis charged over Twitter hack
item.description: The US Department of Justice charged Mason Sheppard, 19, of Bognor Regis, with conspiracy to commit wire fraud, conspiracy to commit money laundering, among other charges.

item.title: Crispin Odey charged with indecently assaulting woman in 1998
item.description: Tory donor Crispin Odey, 61, has denied indecently assaulting a woman in an alleged incident in west London in 1998. Mr Crispin (left) has an £846million fortune with wife Nichola Pease (right)

item.title: Vanessa George among paedophiles hiding past by lawfully changing their name
item.description: Dressed in an anonymous black outfit on a suburban street, Britain's worst female paedophile is utterly inconspicuous as she carries her shopping home, occasionally peering at her phone.

item.title: Whitehall departments are 'ghost towns' with civil servants working from home
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of civil servants are still working from home two weeks after Boris Johnson urged workers to get back to the office to help save the economy.

item.title: Army sergeant shot dead Austin Black Lives Matter protester
item.description: DailyMail.com can reveal the man who shot dead Garrrett Foster in Austin Texas is 33-year-old Daniel Perry, a U.S. Army sergeant and staunch Trump supporter.

item.title: Bill Clinton stayed in Jeffrey Epstein's villa on 'orgy island', court docs claim
item.description: Bill Clinton visited Little St James Island with Epstein, Virginia Roberts, and two young girls from New York where he stayed in the pedophile's villa, Roberts claims in newly-revealed testimony.

item.title: Will my river cruise EVER sail ahead? The Holiday Guru tackles traveller issues
item.description: The Holiday Guru is always on hand to answer your questions. And with the pandemic causing mass confusion among travellers, the Guru's advice has never been more sought after.

item.title: Exploring Britain's uncrowded cities from London to Bath - and there are hotel bargains, too...
item.description: This summer could be the perfect year to visit some of Britain's great cities, with high streets quieter than ever and hotels offering tempting deals. Here's our guide of the top picks.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: Should I run away with the love of my life?
item.description: This week Bel advises a reader who is considering whether or not to leave her husband for the love of her life.

item.title: Court overturns Boston Marathon bomber's death sentence
item.description: Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev had his death sentence overturned by the 1st US Circuit Court of Appeals in Boston on Friday.
item.media:description: FILE - This file photo released April 19, 2013, by the Federal Bureau of Investigation shows Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, convicted and sentenced to death for carrying out the April 15, 2013, Boston Marathon bombing attack that killed three people and injured more than 260. On Friday, July 31, 2020, a federal appeals court overturned the Boston Marathon bomber's death sentence. (FBI via AP, File)

item.title: The Goldbergs' Bryan Callen is accused of sexual assault
item.description: Four women, including actress Kathryn Tigerman and comedian Tiffany King, have accused accused Bryan Callen, 53, of sexual misconduct, ranging from inappropriate comments to rape.

item.title: Meghan and Harry can subpoena photo agencies over Archie photos
item.description: A lawsuit filed by Harry and Meghan in Los Angeles last week alleges 'serial intrusions' into 14-month-old Archie's privacy.

item.title: Director Sir Alan Parker who made Bugsy Malone, Midnight Express and Evita has died at the age of 76
item.description: Tributes flooded in from across the movie industry, today with James Bond producer Barbara Broccoli saying: 'I am heartbroken at the news of Sir Alan Parker's passing.'

item.title: From plush duvets to chandeliers, camping on the Devon coast is as sweet as toasted marshmallows
item.description: Fountain Violet Farm is a 110-acre livestock farm close to the Devon village of Kingswear. Robert Hardman stayed there in a safari-style canvas lodge with his family and found it was a delightful setting.

item.title: Russian billionaire evades extradition to UK with legal loophole
item.description: Sergei Pugachev remains in his chateau in France because the British authorities have failed to haul him back amid apparent confusion over using the European Arrest Warrant.

item.title: Coronavirus: Choirs told singing might be as risky as coughing
item.description: Singing, particularly in large groups for a prolonged duration, should be viewed as a 'more risky practice', a new paper by Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (Sage) has found.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic is causing people to lose their HAIR
item.description: The California-based physician, whose real name is Dr. Sandra Lee, took to TikTok on Thursday to explain why people are suddenly shedding excess hair months after the pandemic.

item.title: Tory MP sparks racism row after claiming 'vast majority' of lockdown breakers are BAME
item.description: Craig Whittaker, who represents Calder Valley in West Yorkshire, was accused of racism yesterday. He made the comments after local lockdowns were imposed on large parts of the North.

item.title: The further afield hotspots from the Caribbean to Dubai that will tempt you with discounts galore
item.description: Despite our summer holidays being all but ruined, long-haul trips later this year and into next year look like a much safer bet - and there are some astonishing deals. Here we reveal the best ones...

item.title: Byron burger chain will SHUT 31 restaurants and make 650 staff redundant
item.description: Byron has been sold in a pre-pack administration to Calveton and will cut 651 staff, with an employee at the company telling MailOnline the redundancies are 'effective immediately'.

item.title: Satellite images reveal two ice caps in the Canadian Arctic have disappeared
item.description: Mark Serreze, director of the National Snow and Ice Data Center, has been studying the St. Patrick Bay ice caps since the 1980s and discovered their disappearance.

item.title: Paedophile woman, 48, jailed 12 years for sex assaults on child
item.description: Sandra O'Rourke, from Hartlepool, sexually assaulted the victim and encouraged them to engage in sexually activity. The child was told that nobody would believe them if they spoke out.

item.title: Six parenting tips to improve a child's bad behavior in days
item.description: The authors of a new book entitled What's My Teenager Thinking? Practical Child Psychology have shared their top tips for improving your child's bad behavior.

item.title: 'Space butterfly' is giant gas bubble floating in Milky Way
item.description: The striking planetary nebula, known as NGC 2899, appears to float and flutter across the sky in this pristine image from ESO's Very Large Telescope (VLT) in Chile.

item.title: Coronavirus Spain: Biggest jump in cases since lockdown end
item.description: Spain's health ministry on Friday reported 3,092 new coronavirus cases, marking the biggest jump since a national lockdown was lifted in June and beating the previous day's record rise.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Wedding restrictions have ended businesses
item.description: Brides, wedding venues and those working in the industry questioning what the Prime Minister's announcement today means for their future, with some fearing they won't survive.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell 'didn't want black girls'
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell told victim Virginia Giuffre that the girls they wanted for sex 'couldn't be black', newly released court documents claim.

item.title: Democrats make Fauci address Donald Trump's coronavirus claims
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci knocked down in rapid fire a number of President Donald Trump's most dubious claims about the coronavirus during a House subcommittee hearing Friday.

item.title: Two in hospital after getting infections spread by tick bites
item.description: This is the first record of a UK-acquired case of babesiosis and the second case of TBE being acquired in the UK, Public Health England (PHE) said.

item.title: Woman jailed for asking three men to murder her ex-husband
item.description: Victoria Breeden, 39, tried to persuade the three men to murder Rob Parkes between 2014 and 2019 and was jailed for nine years and six months today at Chelmsford Crown Court in Essex.

item.title: Ex-UKIP candidate football thug jailed for punching police horse
item.description: Derek Jennings, 53, was sentenced at Portsmouth Crown Court after pleading guilty to violent disorder ahead of the match at Fratton Park on September 24 last year.

item.title: Oxford University students will have to wear face masks
item.description: Students at the University of Oxford will have to wear a covering in any shared indoor space, including the college bars, the students' union and any libraries, unless they have a medical exemption.

item.title: Boris Johnson appears to be BALDING after coronavirus battle
item.description: Twitter users have pointed out Boris Johnson's thinning hairdo. It comes as a recent study found that British bald men are 40 per cent more likely to end up in hospital with coronavirus.

item.title: American Cancer Society advises 'individuals with a cervix'
item.description: The ACS has used the phrase 'individuals with a cervix', rather than 'women' in their guidance because transgender and non-binary individuals can also have a cervix.

item.title: The stylish sisters Chiara and Carolina Di Bourbon-Two Sicilies share a glimpse of their lavish life
item.description: Princesses Maria Chiara, 15, and Maria Carolina of the House of Bourbon-Two Sicilies, 17, are the daughters of Prince Carlo, 57, who holds a claim to the now defunct throne Bourbon-Two Sicilies.

item.title: Car of the future from German firm reassembles like Lego
item.description: Although just concept drawings for now, eBussy is due to launch in the UK next year with a starting price of around £14,000.

item.title: Raheem Sterling and Jay Kay among stars hit by burglary gang
item.description: The gang of 'highly organised' burglars who attempted to steal from Raheem Sterling's mansion in Cheshire, in 2018, today admitted conspiracy to burgle homes across the UK.

item.title: 3D filming shows human sperm swimming in corkscrew motion
item.description: Developed by scientists led from Bristol, the method has overturned a 350-year-old belief that sperm tails lash 'with a snakelike movement, like eels in water.'

item.title: Global cooling 13,000 years ago caused by volcanic eruptions
item.description: Analysis of chemicals found in the soil at Hall's Cave in the Texas Hill Country found the climate cooled due to volcanic activity and not from a meteorite impact.

item.title: Former England midfielder Kieron Dyer claims he was racially abused at a Suffolk golf club
item.description: The former England and Newcastle midfielder visited Hintlesham Golf Club on Friday, July 24 - when a member of the club is said to have made a racist remark towards Dyer.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson 'slams brakes' on lockdown ease
item.description: Mr Johnson warned that coronavirus cases have started to 'creep up' and as a result the Government has no choice but to delay planned further easings.

item.title: Rare BLACK leopard is spotted drinking from a pond and stalking its prey at an Indian reserve
item.description: Abhishek Pangis, from Pune in western Maharashtra state, spent 40 minutes watching the majestic big cat at Tadoba Reserve last month.

item.title: Outrageous mother-in-law interrupts her son's wedding ceremony
item.description: Sarah Ragsdale, from San Jose, California, posted the unbelievable moment that took place during her sister's wedding on TikTok. It shows the mother-in-law interrupting the ceremony just after the bride's vows.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell had sex with 15-year-old girls, court docs claim
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell forced Virginia Roberts to strip, told her to lick Jeffrey Epstein's nipples and to 'straddle him sexually' during their first meeting when she was aged 15, court documents claim.

item.title: 'Whale Whisperer' Christopher Swann's sea life photos
item.description: Christopher Swann, who lives in La Paz, Mexico, and the west coast of Scotland, has twice been an awarded finalist in the prestigious Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition.

item.title: Facebook and Apple both report 11% growth during pandemic
item.description: On Thursday, both tech giants reported results for recently ended quarter, with Facebook saying it made a profit of $5.2 billion on $18.7 billion in revenue, while Apple also shattered analyst expectations.

item.title: Cronyism row as Boris makes his brother a peer - while Theresa May's husband Philip gets knighthood
item.description: Boris Johnson is at the centre of a 'cronyism row' after his own brother Jo was named on a list of 36 new peers in the House of Lords, alongside a handful of other former Tory MPs.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Ministers warned Eid would be 'problematic'
item.description: In a report submitted to Number 10 on July 2, experts advising the UK Government highlighted the Islamic festival as one of 10 events that could see Brits discard social distancing.

item.title: Aston Martin once owned by the Queen for sale for around £75k
item.description: The pristine Vanquish supercar, which is going on sale tomorrow, was first registered to the Royal Privy Purse in Ascot, Berkshire, in 2003 and remained in the Royal household until 2016.

item.title: Apple confirms iPhone 12 release date will be delayed until at least October due to COVID-19
item.description: The announcement means that the new product line will miss that the California-based tech firm's customary September launch window.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Police will now HAVE to enforce mask rules
item.description: The Prime Minister demanded masks be worn in galleries, cinemas and places of worship, as well as in shops and on trains and buses, while insisting the police will ensure the rules are enforced.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 120 new fatalities in preliminary death toll
item.description: Department of Health statistics show it is the most amount of infections registered in a day since June 28, when 901 more Britons were diagnosed with Covid-19.

item.title: US Navy mocks Iran via meme after dummy aircraft attack
item.description: The US Navy poked fun at a fake American aircraft carrier Iran built for target practice in a show of strength by posting an image on Instagram that showed the bogus ship unprotected.

item.title: Europe has 101F (40C) heatwave as wildfires hit France
item.description: Paris is set to reach 104F (40C) temperatures in the shade after several French cities hit record highs on Thursday ahead of a heavy holiday travel weekend.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Cases rise 68% in fortnight
item.description: Number 10's scientific advisers today also upped the R rate in the UK, saying they now believe it stands between 0.8 and 0.9. It had been as low as 0.7 since May.

item.title: Ex-England star Alex Scott reveals she turned to alcohol to help deal with sickening online abuse
item.description: In conversation with Troy Deeney as part of the Heads Up campaign focusing on mental health, the 35-year-old revealed the extent to which the online 'trolling' made her mood change.

item.title: Fury over Boris Johnson's plan to pause shielding as experts say it's not safe to return to work
item.description: The Prime Minister today postponed the relaxation of lockdown in England to stem rising infections. But extremely clinically vulnerable Britons are allowed to return to work as planned.

item.title: This Morning viewers call out show for major geographical blunder
item.description: This Morning fans were not impressed during Friday's show as they called out a major geographical blunder.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Cases are soaring in Shropshire and Swindon
item.description: NHS statistics reveal infections nearly tripled in Shropshire in the week ending July 28, rising by 280 per cent after 19 people caught the virus. In Swindon, cases surged by 225 per cent.

item.title: Woman, 82, would rather go to PRISON than pay TV licence fee
item.description: Ivy Siegfried from Inverclyde told This Morning hosts Rochelle Humes and Dermot O'Leary that she doesn't agree with the idea of being means tested at the age of 82.

item.title: Zebra makes lucky escape from crocodile in Kenya in video
item.description: As a herd of zebra cross the Mara River, near the Masai Mara National Reserve in Kenya, one is caught in the jaws of a crocodile but the zebra manages to wriggle free as they reach the riverbank.

item.title: Prince Andrew 'lobbied US government over Epstein plea deal'
item.description: Prince Andrew 'lobbied the US government for a favourable plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein' when the pedophile was jailed for procuring underage prostitutes in 2009, new court files allege.

item.title: Oscar Wilde's questionnaire answers to go for £60k at auction
item.description: The writer posited his thoughts on 39 topics in Robert Saxon's Mental Photographs - an album from 1877 for confessions of tastes, habits and convictions.

item.title: Jihadi bride Shamima Begum's return to UK on HOLD after appeal
item.description: Begum, who left to join IS five years ago when she was 15, had been stripped of her British citizenship after she was found in a Syrian refugee camp.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: UK's first Dutch-style roundabout opens today in Cambridge
item.description: The roundabout features a red cycle lane around it and motorists need to give way if it's in use. Narrowed roads with pedestrian crossings on the entry and exit will slow traffic.

item.title: Dog shelter horror: Twenty puppies are tortured to death at animal refuge in Tunisia
item.description: GRAPHIC CONTENT WARNING: Photographs taken by volunteers show dogs lying in pools of blood after they were beaten to death with sticks on the island of Djerba on Thursday, July 23.

item.title: Rare Rolex Submariner watch like the one worn by James Bond set to sell for £150,000 at auction
item.description: The stainless steel Submariner wristwatch was sourced in 1970 and it is now worth 1,500 times more than the owner, who has not been named, paid for it.

item.title: Madeleine McCann suspect Christian Brueckner in 'kidnap' campervan weeks before she vanished
item.description: Madeleine McCann prime suspect Christian Brueckner was filmed at the wheel of a battered VW campervan just weeks before German police believed he used it to kidnap Madeleine.

item.title: Journalist slams 'black and white selfie challenge' loved by celebs
item.description: Speaking to Rochelle Humes and Dermot O'Leary on This Morning, from her home in south London Kat Brown said the challenge was 'vacuous' and missed the point.

item.title: Outrage in Germany after Afghan migrant 'rapes two girls'
item.description: The 23-year-old was first arrested in June but released less than two weeks later after authorities in Dortmund claimed there was no evidence he was likely to re-offend.

item.title: Ex-boyfriend, 50, harassed 45-year-old teacher he met on Plenty of Fish with gifts and messages
item.description: Emma Murby from Eldwick, West Yorkshire, had split up with Timothy Green but he bombarded her with flowers, chocolates and even posed as one of her friends.

item.title: Ex-football coach and serial paedophile Barry Bennell, 66, admits nine more sex offences
item.description: Barry Bennell, who is also known as Richard Jones, entered the pleas at Chester Crown Court today and appeared via video-link from HMP Littlehey in Cambridgeshire.

item.title: Katie Price sunbathes following plea for help to find mobility scooter after breaking her feet
item.description: The glamour model, 42, was rushed to hospital in Turkey on Wednesday, after breaking both of her feet and ankles in a horror accident, and on Friday took to Instagram Stories to give fans an update

item.title: Woman forced to sleep rough in Amsterdam after travel agent 'cancelled hotel booking'
item.description: Zea Hudson, 26, turned up at her hotel in the city but was turned away after hotel clerks said the travel agent had cancelled their booking a week earlier.

item.title: Prime suspect in horrific rape and murder of a British safari lodge owner is arrested
item.description: Retired teacher Christine Robinson, 59, was allegedly attacked by a trusted gardener at the 125 acre Rra-Ditau lodge she ran alone in South Africa. The prime suspect was arrested yesterday.

item.title: Australia unveils law forcing tech giants to pay for news
item.description: The crackdown is targeting stories that appear in Google searches and Facebook's news feed without any money going to the Australian news firms which actually produce them.
item.media:description: Facebook and Google have strongly opposed any move forcing them to share advertising revenue

item.title: Husband surprises his wife with new kayak strapped to the car roof but doesn't realise it's too tall
item.description: The video shows an unnamed man tying a bright green kayak to the top of a red Chevrolet SUV as a surprise for his wife, in Vero Beach, Florida - but hasn't realized it won't fit through the garage door.

item.title: Just 45% of us actually know what the lockdown rules are - down from 90%, study reveals
item.description: University College London researchers found that only 45 per cent of people in England understand the lockdown rules, compared with 90 per cent understanding the rules in March.

item.title: TV comedian Eddie Large left just £44,100 in his will when he died from Covid-19 earlier this year
item.description: The comedian, who performed alongside Syd Little in the Little and Large show, died in April aged 78 at the Southmead Hospital in Bristol after contracting coronavirus.

item.title: How good is YOUR Math? Quiz will test your knowledge
item.description: The 25-question challenge was shared to Playbuzz by US-based creator Terry Stein, who said it has been 'driving the internet crazy'. Do you have what it takes to score full marks?

item.title: Coronavirus Scotland: 14-day quarantine on Luxembourg arrivals
item.description: The government has followed Scotland's decision to remove Luxembourg from list of travel exemptions for the whole of the UK following a 'significant change' in the number of covid-19 cases.

item.title: Britain's Covid-19 cases rise AGAIN with infections up 12% in a week
item.description: Department of Health chiefs today announced another 38 people who tested positive for coronavirus have died, down from the 78 deaths recorded yesterday.
